org.wickedsource.logunit

Class LogUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wickedsource.logunit.LogUnit
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LogUnitForJUnit, LogUnitForTestNG

    public abstract class LogUnit
extends Object
    This class allows defining and asserting Expectations within a unit test. The procedure should be as follows:
    1. Make sure that you have the LogUnit modules for your logging framework and your unit testing framework in your classpath (for example logunit-junit4 and logunit-log4j12 if you are using JUnit 4 as unit testing framework and Log4J 1.2.x as your logging framework).
    2. Configure your logging framework with the LogUnit appender so LogUnit is notified of log events (LogUnitLog4JConsoleAppender in the case of log4j).
    3. In your unit test, get an instance of the LogUnit class by calling LogUnit.get().
    4. Use the expect* methods of the LogUnit instance to define which log statements you expect to be logged in the unit test.
    5. Call the code under test.
    6. Call LogUnit.assertExpectations() to assert that all logging expectations have been fulfilled.
    Author:
    Tom Hombergs

      • assertExpectations

        protected abstract void assertExpectations(Set<Expectation> expectations)
        This method has to be implemented for the unit test framework in use. Each expectation passed to the method must be asserted by checking if expectation.isFulfilled() returns true.

        If an expectation is not fulfilled, this method should cause a unit test to fail and display the string representation ( expectation.toString()) of the failed expectation to the user.

        Parameters:
        expectations - the expectations to assert

      • assertExpectations

        public void assertExpectations()
        This method uses the assertion facilities of a given unit test framework to assert that all expectations that have been defined are fulfilled.

      • getExpectations

        public Set<Expectation> getExpectations()

      • get

        public static LogUnit get()
        Returns the singleton implementation of the LogUnit abstract super class.
        Returns:
        the singleton implementation of the LogUnit abstract super class.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if more than one implementations of LogUnit are found on the classpath.

      • setInstance

        public static void setInstance(LogUnit implementation)
        Explicitly sets the singleton LogUnit instance to the given implementation. Subsequent calls to get() will then return the given implementation.
        Parameters:
        implementation - the LogUnit implementation to use as singleton instance.
